slides.title: Welcome to Inventory Management
slides.content:
# Inventory Management in Tally

Tally provides comprehensive **inventory management** features for businesses that deal with physical goods.

## What You Will Learn

- **Stock Groups and Items** - Organizing inventory
- **Godowns/Warehouses** - Location management
- **Stock Valuation** - FIFO, LIFO, Average
- **Inventory Reports** - Stock analysis

## Enabling Inventory

**F11 > Inventory Features**

```
Maintain Stock Items: Yes
Maintain Multiple Godowns: Yes
Tracking Numbers: Yes
Use Batch-wise Details: [Optional]
Use Expiry Dates: [Optional]
```

## Benefits of Inventory in Tally

| Feature | Benefit |
|---------|--------|
| Real-time tracking | Know stock at any moment |
| Multiple locations | Manage warehouses |
| Valuation methods | Accurate costing |
| Batch tracking | Quality and expiry |
| Auto accounting | Seamless integration |

## Inventory Flow

```
Purchase --> Stock In --> Sales --> Stock Out
    |            |            |
    v            v            v
   Cost        Current    Revenue
   Update      Stock      & COGS
```

> **Inventory management** is crucial for trading businesses!

slides.title: Stock Groups
slides.content:
# Organizing Stock with Groups

## What are Stock Groups?

Stock groups **categorize inventory items** for better organization and reporting.

## Default Stock Group

- Primary (root level)
- All items belong here if no group specified

## Creating Stock Groups

**Path:** Gateway > Create > Stock Group

```
+----------------------------------+
| Stock Group Creation             |
+----------------------------------+
| Name: Electronics                |
| Under: Primary                   |
| Should Quantities Add: Yes       |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Stock Group Hierarchy

```
Primary
  |
  +-- Electronics
  |     +-- Mobile Phones
  |     +-- Laptops
  |     +-- Accessories
  |
  +-- Furniture
  |     +-- Office Furniture
  |     +-- Home Furniture
  |
  +-- Raw Materials
        +-- Steel
        +-- Plastic
        +-- Wood
```

## Benefits of Grouping

| Benefit | Example |
|---------|--------|
| Organized view | Category-wise reports |
| Group totals | Electronics total value |
| Easy search | Find within category |
| Consistent pricing | Group-level discounts |

## Altering Stock Groups

**Path:** Gateway > Alter > Stock Group

- Rename groups
- Move to different parent
- Delete if empty

> **Good organization** makes inventory management easier!

slides.title: Stock Items
slides.content:
# Creating Stock Items

## What is a Stock Item?

A stock item is an **individual product** that you buy, store, or sell.

## Stock Item Creation

**Path:** Gateway > Create > Stock Item

```
+----------------------------------+
| Stock Item Creation              |
+----------------------------------+
| Name: Samsung Galaxy S24         |
| Under: Mobile Phones             |
| Units: Nos                       |
+----------------------------------+
| Opening Balance:                 |
| Quantity: 50 Nos                 |
| Rate: Rs. 45,000                 |
| Value: Rs. 22,50,000             |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| Name | Item name |
| Under | Stock group |
| Units | Unit of measure |
| Opening Qty | Starting stock |
| Opening Rate | Cost per unit |

## Units of Measure

### Creating Units

**Path:** Gateway > Create > Unit

```
Symbol: Nos
Formal Name: Numbers

Symbol: Kgs
Formal Name: Kilograms

Symbol: Ltrs
Formal Name: Liters
```

### Compound Units

```
Box of 10 Nos:
First Unit: Box
Second Unit: Nos
Conversion: 1 Box = 10 Nos
```

## Stock Item Categories

| Type | Track Stock |
|------|-------------|
| Goods | Yes |
| Services | No |
| Consumables | Optional |

> **Accurate item setup** ensures correct inventory tracking!

slides.title: Godowns and Locations
slides.content:
# Managing Multiple Locations

## What are Godowns?

Godowns are **storage locations** where inventory is kept.

## Enabling Godowns

**F11 > Inventory Features**

```
Maintain Multiple Godowns: Yes
```

## Creating Godowns

**Path:** Gateway > Create > Godown

```
+----------------------------------+
| Godown Creation                  |
+----------------------------------+
| Name: Mumbai Warehouse           |
| Under: Primary                   |
| Address: 123 Industrial Area     |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Godown Hierarchy

```
Primary
  |
  +-- Main Warehouse
  |     +-- Zone A
  |     +-- Zone B
  |
  +-- Showroom
  |
  +-- Transit Stock
```

## Stock in Transaction

### Purchase Entry

```
+----------------------------------+
| Purchase Voucher                 |
+----------------------------------+
| Item: Samsung Galaxy S24         |
| Quantity: 100 Nos                |
| Godown: Mumbai Warehouse         |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Stock Transfer Between Godowns

### Stock Journal

```
+----------------------------------+
| Stock Journal                    |
+----------------------------------+
| Transfer From: Mumbai Warehouse  |
| Transfer To: Delhi Warehouse     |
| Item: Samsung Galaxy S24         |
| Quantity: 25 Nos                 |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Godown Reports

- Stock by Godown
- Movement by Location
- Godown Summary

> **Multi-location tracking** ensures stock visibility!

slides.title: Purchase and Sales with Inventory
slides.content:
# Inventory Transactions

## Purchase with Stock Update

### Invoice Mode (Ctrl+V for Item Invoice)

```
+------------------------------------------+
| Purchase Voucher (F9)                    |
+------------------------------------------+
| Party: ABC Suppliers                     |
| Invoice No: SUP-001                      |
+------------------------------------------+
| Item          | Qty  | Rate    | Amount |
| Samsung S24   | 50   | 45,000  | 22.5L  |
| iPhone 15     | 30   | 80,000  | 24.0L  |
+------------------------------------------+
| CGST @ 9%:                        4.185L |
| SGST @ 9%:                        4.185L |
| Total:                           54.87L  |
+------------------------------------------+
```

## Sales with Stock Update

### Invoice Mode

```
+------------------------------------------+
| Sales Voucher (F8)                       |
+------------------------------------------+
| Party: XYZ Retailers                     |
| Invoice No: INV-001                      |
+------------------------------------------+
| Item          | Qty  | Rate    | Amount |
| Samsung S24   | 10   | 55,000  | 5.5L   |
+------------------------------------------+
| Godown: Main Warehouse                   |
| Available Stock: 50 Nos                  |
| After Sale: 40 Nos                       |
+------------------------------------------+
```

## Automatic Entries

### Purchase

```
Purchase A/c (Dr)     46.5L
Input CGST (Dr)        4.185L
Input SGST (Dr)        4.185L
Vendor A/c (Cr)       54.87L
Stock Updated +80 units
```

### Sales

```
Customer A/c (Dr)      6.49L
Sales A/c (Cr)         5.5L
Output CGST (Cr)       0.495L
Output SGST (Cr)       0.495L
Stock Updated -10 units
```

> **Integrated transactions** update both accounts and stock!

slides.title: Stock Valuation Methods
slides.content:
# Inventory Valuation

## Valuation Methods in Tally

### 1. FIFO (First In First Out)

- Oldest stock sold first
- Common for perishables

### 2. LIFO (Last In First Out)

- Newest stock sold first
- Tax benefits in inflation

### 3. Weighted Average

- Average cost of all purchases
- Most common method

## Setting Valuation Method

**F11 > Inventory Features**

```
Costing Method for Valuation: Average Cost
OR
Costing Method: FIFO
OR
Costing Method: LIFO
```

## Example: Average Cost

```
Opening: 100 units @ Rs. 10 = Rs. 1,000
Purchase 1: 50 units @ Rs. 12 = Rs. 600
Purchase 2: 50 units @ Rs. 14 = Rs. 700

Total: 200 units = Rs. 2,300
Average Cost: Rs. 2,300 / 200 = Rs. 11.50
```

## Example: FIFO

```
Sale of 120 units:
- 100 units @ Rs. 10 = Rs. 1,000
- 20 units @ Rs. 12 = Rs. 240
- COGS = Rs. 1,240
```

## Example: LIFO

```
Sale of 120 units:
- 50 units @ Rs. 14 = Rs. 700
- 50 units @ Rs. 12 = Rs. 600
- 20 units @ Rs. 10 = Rs. 200
- COGS = Rs. 1,500
```

> **Choose the right method** for accurate costing!

slides.title: Batch and Expiry Tracking
slides.content:
# Batch-wise Inventory

## Enabling Batch Tracking

**F11 > Inventory Features**

```
Use Batch-wise Details: Yes
Use Expiry Dates: Yes
```

### In Stock Item

```
Track Batches: Yes
Track Expiry: Yes
```

## Purchase with Batch

```
+----------------------------------+
| Purchase Voucher                 |
+----------------------------------+
| Item: Medicine ABC               |
| Quantity: 100 Nos                |
+----------------------------------+
| Batch Allocations:               |
| Batch No: BATCH-001              |
| Mfg Date: 01-Jan-2024            |
| Expiry Date: 31-Dec-2025         |
| Quantity: 100 Nos                |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Sales with Batch

```
+----------------------------------+
| Sales Voucher                    |
+----------------------------------+
| Item: Medicine ABC               |
| Quantity: 25 Nos                 |
+----------------------------------+
| Select Batch:                    |
| BATCH-001 (Exp: 31-Dec-2025)     |
| Available: 100, Selling: 25      |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Benefits

| Feature | Use Case |
|---------|----------|
| Batch tracking | Quality recall |
| Expiry dates | Pharma, food |
| FEFO | First Expiry First Out |
| Mfg date | Warranty tracking |

## Batch Reports

- Batch Summary
- Expiry Report
- Batch Movement

> **Batch tracking** ensures product traceability!

slides.title: Stock Journal
slides.content:
# Stock Transfer and Adjustment

## What is Stock Journal?

Stock journal records **internal stock movements** without affecting accounts.

## Stock Transfer (Godown to Godown)

```
+----------------------------------+
| Stock Journal                    |
+----------------------------------+
| Source (Consumption):            |
| Item: Samsung S24                |
| Godown: Mumbai Warehouse         |
| Quantity: 20 Nos                 |
+----------------------------------+
| Destination (Production):        |
| Item: Samsung S24                |
| Godown: Delhi Warehouse          |
| Quantity: 20 Nos                 |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Manufacturing Entry

### Raw Material to Finished Good

```
+----------------------------------+
| Stock Journal (Manufacturing)    |
+----------------------------------+
| Consumption:                     |
| Steel - 50 Kgs @ Rs. 80          |
| Plastic - 10 Kgs @ Rs. 100       |
| Total Cost: Rs. 5,000            |
+----------------------------------+
| Production:                      |
| Metal Chair - 10 Nos @ Rs. 500   |
| Total Value: Rs. 5,000           |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Stock Adjustment

### Physical Stock Correction

```
+----------------------------------+
| Stock Journal (Adjustment)       |
+----------------------------------+
| Destination (Add to stock):      |
| Item: Widget A                   |
| Quantity: 5 Nos (found)          |
| Rate: Rs. 100                    |
+----------------------------------+
| OR                               |
+----------------------------------+
| Source (Remove from stock):      |
| Item: Widget B                   |
| Quantity: 3 Nos (shortage)       |
| Rate: Rs. 150                    |
+----------------------------------+
```

> **Stock journals** manage internal movements!

slides.title: Physical Stock Verification
slides.content:
# Physical Stock Count

## Why Physical Verification?

- Match book stock with actual
- Identify discrepancies
- Adjust for theft, damage, expiry
- Compliance requirement

## Physical Stock Entry

**Path:** Gateway > Vouchers > Physical Stock (Alt+F7)

```
+----------------------------------+
| Physical Stock Voucher           |
+----------------------------------+
| Date: 31-Mar-2024                |
| Godown: Main Warehouse           |
+----------------------------------+
| Item        | Book | Physical    |
| Samsung S24 | 100  | 98          |
| iPhone 15   | 50   | 50          |
| Accessories | 200  | 195         |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Recording Count

### Method 1: Full Count

Enter physical quantity for all items.

### Method 2: Difference Only

Enter only items with variance.

## After Physical Stock

### Shortage Entry

```
Stock Shortage Found:
  Samsung S24: 2 Nos short

Journal/Stock Journal:
  Stock Shortage A/c (Dr)
  Stock A/c (Cr)
```

### Excess Found

```
Stock Excess Found:
  Widget A: 5 Nos excess

Journal/Stock Journal:
  Stock A/c (Dr)
  Stock Excess A/c (Cr)
```

## Physical Stock Report

- Variance Report
- Stock as on Date
- Verification History

> **Regular verification** keeps inventory accurate!

slides.title: Stock Movement Vouchers
slides.content:
# Delivery and Receipt Notes

## Delivery Note

### When to Use
- Goods sent before billing
- Material on approval
- Inter-branch transfer

### Creating Delivery Note

```
+----------------------------------+
| Delivery Note                    |
+----------------------------------+
| Party: Customer ABC              |
| Tracking No: DN-001              |
+----------------------------------+
| Item: Samsung S24                |
| Quantity: 10 Nos                 |
| From Godown: Main Warehouse      |
+----------------------------------+
```

### Convert to Sales Invoice

Later, create sales voucher referencing delivery note.

## Receipt Note

### When to Use
- Goods received before invoice
- Quality inspection pending
- GRN (Goods Receipt Note)

### Creating Receipt Note

```
+----------------------------------+
| Receipt Note                     |
+----------------------------------+
| Party: Supplier XYZ              |
| Tracking No: RN-001              |
+----------------------------------+
| Item: Raw Material A             |
| Quantity: 500 Kgs                |
| To Godown: Production Store      |
+----------------------------------+
```

### Convert to Purchase

Later, record purchase invoice referencing receipt note.

## Pending Notes Report

- Delivery Notes pending invoice
- Receipt Notes pending invoice

> **Movement vouchers** provide tracking visibility!

slides.title: Bill of Materials (BOM)
slides.content:
# Manufacturing with BOM

## What is BOM?

Bill of Materials lists all **components needed to manufacture** a finished product.

## Enabling BOM

**F11 > Inventory Features**

```
Set Components (BOM) for Stock Items: Yes
```

## Creating BOM

### In Finished Good Item

```
+----------------------------------+
| Stock Item: Metal Table          |
| Under: Finished Goods            |
+----------------------------------+
| Components (BOM):                |
| Steel Sheet - 10 Kgs @ Rs. 80    |
| Screws - 20 Nos @ Rs. 5          |
| Paint - 1 Ltr @ Rs. 200          |
| Labor (if tracked)               |
+----------------------------------+
| Total Component Cost: Rs. 1,100  |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Using BOM in Production

### Stock Journal

```
+----------------------------------+
| Manufacturing Entry              |
+----------------------------------+
| Produce: Metal Table - 10 Nos    |
+----------------------------------+
| Auto-consume per BOM:            |
| Steel Sheet: 100 Kgs             |
| Screws: 200 Nos                  |
| Paint: 10 Ltrs                   |
+----------------------------------+
```

## BOM Reports

- Component Requirement
- Production Summary
- Variance Analysis

## Benefits

| Feature | Benefit |
|---------|--------|
| Auto consumption | Less entry |
| Cost calculation | Accurate costing |
| Requirement planning | Know needs |
| Variance tracking | Quality control |

> **BOM enables** efficient manufacturing planning!

slides.title: Inventory Reporting Period End
slides.content:
# Inventory Period-End Activities

## Month-End Checklist

### 1. Physical Verification

- Count all stock
- Record physical stock
- Investigate differences

### 2. Stock Valuation

```
+----------------------------------+
| Stock Valuation Report           |
+----------------------------------+
| Opening Stock:        50,00,000  |
| Purchases:           1,20,00,000 |
| Sales (at cost):       90,00,000 |
| Closing Stock:         80,00,000 |
+----------------------------------+
```

### 3. COGS Calculation

```
Cost of Goods Sold:
Opening Stock    +    50,00,000
Purchases        + 1,20,00,000
                 ---------------
Goods Available  = 1,70,00,000
Closing Stock    -    80,00,000
                 ---------------
COGS             =    90,00,000
```

### 4. Adjustments

- Stock write-offs
- Expired goods
- Damaged goods
- Obsolete inventory

## Year-End Activities

- Complete physical verification
- Reconcile stock register
- Finalize valuation method
- Year-end stock report
- Audit preparation

## Key Reports

| Report | Purpose |
|--------|--------|
| Stock Summary | Current position |
| Stock Valuation | Value by method |
| Movement Report | Inward/outward |
| Aging Report | Slow moving |

> **Period-end activities** ensure accurate reporting!

slides.title: Inventory Best Practices
slides.content:
# Best Practices

## Master Data Quality

| Practice | Benefit |
|----------|--------|
| Consistent naming | Easy search |
| Proper units | Accurate counting |
| Complete details | Full tracking |
| Regular review | Clean data |

## Transaction Discipline

### Real-Time Entry
- Same-day voucher entry
- Immediate stock update
- Accurate availability

### Proper Documentation
- Reference numbers
- Narration
- Supporting documents

## Physical Controls

### Warehouse Management

- Designated locations
- FIFO arrangement
- Regular counts
- Access control

### Periodic Verification

| Frequency | Method |
|-----------|--------|
| Daily | High-value items |
| Weekly | Fast-moving items |
| Monthly | Full count |
| Quarterly | Audit count |

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

| Mistake | Impact |
|---------|--------|
| Delayed entry | Stock mismatch |
| Wrong quantities | Incorrect reports |
| Missing batches | Traceability lost |
| No backup | Data loss risk |

## Reports to Monitor

- Daily Stock Summary
- Weekly Movement
- Negative Stock Alert
- Reorder Status

> **Good practices** prevent inventory problems!

- Movement analysis

|----------|----------|
| Stock Group | Create > Stock Group |
